subject: Science
description: Climate researchers meeting in Berlin have been accused of not paying enough attention to the interests of developing countries.
title: IPCC accused of 'marginalising' poor

subject: Science
description: The competition to manufacture the next generation of Europe's most important series of weather satellites is won by Airbus Defence and Space.
title: Airbus wins major weather prize

subject: Science
description: As the UN's climate panel meets in Berlin, Germany's fossil fuel industry is as busy as ever, reports David Shukman.
title: Germany's green dreams meet harsh reality

subject: Science
description: Four women have had new vaginas grown in the laboratory and implanted by doctors in the US.
title: Doctors implant lab-grown vagina

subject: Science
description: New research shows that when a threat comes into view fruit flies make split-second turns reminiscent of those made by fighter jets.
title: Flies manoeuvre like fighter jets

subject: Science
description: Pet rabbits need better legal protection in the UK, according to an animal welfare researcher.
title: Call to review pet rabbit protection

subject: Science
description: Communities Secretary Eric Pickles has staged a minor coup over coalition energy policy.
title: Pickles increases energy policy role

subject: Science
description: Scientists list the world's most distinctive and endangered birds.
title: The 100 most distinct and rare birds

subject: Science
description: Researchers say that plans to restrict wind farms to the seas around Britain will require significantly larger subsidies.
title: Curbing wind energy to push up bills

subject: Science
description: The United Nations is likely to warn governments that a "dash for gas" will not solve climate change, the BBC's Roger Harrabin reports.
title: UN set to warn over 'dash for gas'

subject: Science
description: Hundreds of millions of pounds have been wasted on Tamiflu, a drug for flu that may work no better than paracetamol, a landmark analysis says.
title: 'Millions wasted' on flu drug

subject: Science
description: UN experts say they underestimated the gains carmakers have made in fuel efficiency, but a huge expected increase in global traffic may outweigh this.
title: Car fumes cut easier than UN thought

subject: Science
description: The General Lighthouse Authorities of the UK and Ireland issue a map illustrating the effects of the outage that hit Russia's GLONASS sat-nav system.
title: Map illustrates 'Russian GPS' fault

subject: Science
description: A wolf is spotted in the woods of the Czech Republic, a hundred years after it disappeared from the area.
title: Czech wolf returns after century away

subject: Science
description: UK scientists have challenged the idea that the Titanic was unlucky for sailing in a year when there were an exceptional number of icebergs in the North Atlantic.
title: Challenge to Titanic sinking theory

subject: Science
description: A new burrowing robot for anchoring miniature submarines has been developed, inspired by the Atlantic razor clam.
title: 'RoboClam' could anchor submarines

subject: Science
description: The Ebola outbreak could take up to four months to contain as the number of people killed by the virus in Guinea passes 100, the UN says.
title: Guinea 'Ebola deaths pass 100'

subject: Science
description: Scientists produce a precise measurement of the rate at which the early Universe was expanding to try to get new insights on dark energy.
title: Cosmos speed-check for dark energy

subject: Science
description: The European Union begins the roll-out of its multi-billion-euro series of Earth-observation satellites called Sentinels.
title: EU launches flagship space project

subject: Science
description: Australia's air safety body is looking into reports that a triathlete has been injured by a drone falling on her.
title: Athlete injured after drone crash

subject: Science
description: New measurements by Nasa's Cassini probe suggest Saturn's moon Enceladus hides a mass of liquid water as big as Lake Superior under its icy surface.

subject: Science
description: Video footage emerges of what some people have claimed is a meteorite falling to Earth and narrowly missing a skydiver.
title: VIDEO: Video of skydiver's 'meteorite' near miss

subject: Science
description: Global investment in renewables fell during 2013, but the percentage of the world’s electricity generated by renewable sources continued to increase, a report shows.
title: Global dip in renewables investment

subject: Science
description: A volcanic island in the Pacific Ocean has merged with its neighbour to form one landmass, the US space agency says.
title: Volcanic islands merge in Pacific

subject: Science
description: A new EU study shows that far more honeybees are dying in the UK and other parts of northern Europe than in the Mediterranean.
title: 'More bee deaths' in northern Europe

subject: Science
description: Scientists make crucial new discoveries about one of the world's rarest birds, the blackthroated blue robin, with a breeding pair spotted in China.
title: Very rare Chinese robin sighted

subject: Science
description: Spiders crawling into the fuel tanks of Mazda cars have forced the company to issue a voluntary recall notice to apply a software fix.

subject: Science
description: The government has said it will not expand badger culling to other areas this year to reduce TB in cattle.
title: No expansion for badger culling

subject: Science
description: A rogue bird threatens to destroy the clutch of four peregrine falcon eggs being nurtured on the spire of Norwich Cathedral.

subject: Science
description: Female humpback whales with calves head for the shallows to avoid sexual harassment, according to a new study.

description: The number of birds of prey found dead in a part of the Highlands has now risen to 18, RSPB Scotland say.
